page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY DARTMOOR
page.content: Near Cold East Cross is a {Buckland Parish }boundary stone inscribed with BPB 1837.Two more stones are placed to the North with A and B written on opposing sides. A stone between these has P.W.l746 written on it. In the village of Buckland the largest house is {Buckland Court,}an early Victorian mansion.In World War 2 American soldiers lived there.It is now in ruins with the windows boarded up. Another large house in the area is{Halsanger Manor}.It was built in Elizabethan times and rebuilt at the end of the 19th.century.It is still inhabited and well kept. There is a disused tin and arsenic mine shaft in Whiddon Wood and earlier tin workings near Pennsland Bridge.
